Class SmoothMover

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • SmoothMover
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Affector, BlackHole, Collider, Cursor
    public abstract class SmoothMover
extends greenfoot.Actor
    A variation of an actor that maintains precise location (using doubles for the co-ordinates instead of ints). It also maintains a current velocity in form of a velocity vector. This is a variation of the SmoothMover class presented ealier in the book (version 2.0). This version implements wrap-around movement: when the actor moves out of the world at one side, it enters it again at the opposite edge. This has also now been modified to have methods for generating a vector between points, and working with affectors and gravitational forces, as well as collisions between objects
    Version:
    3.5
    Author:
    Poul Henriksen, Michael KÃ¶lling, Jackson Roberts, Emerson Coskey

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        Move in the direction of the velocity vector. This simulates movement in one time unit (dt==1). Wrap around to the opposite edge of the screen if moving out of the world.

      • setLocation
